title: (x) Foundry icons {anon}
content:
Hi there guys   
   
i am making an order of my fonts libray and i coludn't find out wich type founfry this icons belong to.   
   
please, your help will be appreciatte   
   
 ![foundry icons](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419100133im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/7982.jpg)
author: cgonzalez

comments.content:
didnt have time to really look, but you can probably find the answer here:   
 [http://fontinfo.net/Foundry\_Font\_Icons\_sm.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419100133/http:/fontinfo.net/Foundry_Font_Icons_sm.html)

oh, guys, this one too   
   
 ![icon8](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419100133im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/7985.jpg)   
   
CG   
   
pd. kemie, thanks a lot for the link, it's very usefull but there are still a few with no answer   
   
anonymous...i support the idea of bringing this information to typophile

anonymous, thanxs a lot for your help   
   
CG

1, 2 & 5 look like generic PS outline font icons.   
   
7 [T-26](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419100133/http:/www.t26.com/changeyourface.php)   
   
Usually this information can be found in the 'Info'-box: click the icon and press command-I.
Kemie's linked list is quite incomplete. It might be an idea to create a similar resource on Typophile.

4 [DTC (Digital Typeface Corporation)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419100133/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/dtc/) fonts?   
   
6 converted [LaserMaster](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419100133/http:/www.closerange.com/lm1000_gs.html) fonts? The logo looks similar.

3 [InterType](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419100133/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/intertype/) fonts? I'm just playing Sherlock Holmes here.   
   
Elementary, my dear Watson.
Did you already try _command-I_ as I suggested? It works for the fonts on my computer.
